subject: Re: City of Eugene Requested: ALPR mapping project
body:
[EXTERNAL ?]

Detective,

Which location on Deployment Plan https://planner.flocksafety.com/planning-portal/deployment-tracker/public/0f92e14e805f30bf6acf29115ee1c5822b6098ae5c2df90d1c711d20287fcfc85c97710dd98fe864a5dac6f9814a58b68c5803a8fb3289594d80da7ee50a5761  is it? If you can confirm this and then share any photos that would be great. Send them to support@flocksafety.com support@flocksafety.com  with me cc'd on the email. They will be the ones to begin the steps to get this replaced. I would get this process started myself for you, but leadership on that team has said it is best when the customer reaches out to get the resolution process started.

Regards
	
 
Matt Triana
Project Manager



	
 https://kesq.com/news/2024/06/24/flock-license-plate-reading-cameras-have-led-to-more-than-30-arrests-says-palm-springs-police-department?utm_campaign=EmailSignature&utm_source=PMO&utm_medium=Wisestamp 

	
 	 
 <https://tracy.srv.wisestamp.com/px/wsid/GG1LX1QJMN.png> 


On Fri, May 30, 2025 at 8:09?AM DEWITT Derek A <DDeWitt@eugene-or.gov DDeWitt@eugene-or.gov > wrote:


	Good morning,

	Thank you for the update, hopefully lumen and the other entities can get this hashed out and we can install them all around the same time. We had a flock pole cut in half and damaged. So we will need to fix that one as well.  

	Detective D. DeWitt
	Financial Crimes Unit
	Special Weapons and Tactics Team
	Eugene Police Department
	300 County Club Road
	Eugene, OR 97401
	Work hours: Tuesday - Friday 7:30 a.m. � 5:30 p.m.
	Desk Phone � 541-682-2682
	Work Celll � 541-743-6192
________________________________

	From: Matt Triana <matt.triana@flocksafety.com matt.triana@flocksafety.com >
	Sent: Friday, May 30, 2025 7:39:53 AM
	To: DEWITT Derek A <DDeWitt@eugene-or.gov DDeWitt@eugene-or.gov >
	Subject: Re: FW: City of Eugene Requested: ALPR mapping project 
	 

	[EXTERNAL ?]

	Hi Detective,

	Happy Friday. Tobin looped in someone else from Lumen to assist with whatever joint use agreement they need. Hopefully she will get back to us with some info soon.

	By my count, we have a total of thirteen cameras left to install. Aside from the one Lumen pole location, some of these are city locations that we recently moved and are pending approval to move forward with from the city. Then there are the two county locations and the county told us recently that they were "sending these to permit processing." We will be following up with them next week. The leftovers are permitted and should be installed by the end of next week. Will get you another update next week.

	Please let me know if you have any questions.

	Regards
	
 
Matt Triana
Project Manager



	
 https://kesq.com/news/2024/06/24/flock-license-plate-reading-cameras-have-led-to-more-than-30-arrests-says-palm-springs-police-department?utm_campaign=EmailSignature&utm_source=PMO&utm_medium=Wisestamp 

	
 	 
	 <https://tracy.srv.wisestamp.com/px/wsid/GG1LX1QJMN.png> 


	On Fri, May 23, 2025 at 8:35?AM DEWITT Derek A <DDeWitt@eugene-or.gov DDeWitt@eugene-or.gov > wrote:
	

		Perfect, thank you.

		
		Derek

		 

		Detective D. DeWitt

		Financial Crimes Unit

		Special Weapons and Tactics Team

		Background Investigations Team

		Eugene Police Department

		300 County Club Road

		Eugene, OR 97401

		Work hours: Tuesday - Friday 7:30 a.m. � 5:30 p.m.

		Desk Phone � 541-682-2682

		Work Cell � 541-743-6192



		From: Matt Triana <matt.triana@flocksafety.com matt.triana@flocksafety.com > 
		Sent: Friday, May 23, 2025 8:32 AM
		To: DEWITT Derek A <DDeWitt@eugene-or.gov DDeWitt@eugene-or.gov >
		Subject: Re: FW: City of Eugene Requested: ALPR mapping project

		 

		[EXTERNAL ?]

		Detective,

		 

		Your email is enough to push it forward on our end. Will get the location in front of the city to make sure we get the proper approvals before moving forward with it. Will get you another update early next week on where we stand on completed and pending installs

		 

		Regards

	
 

Matt Triana
Project Manager



	
 https://kesq.com/news/2024/06/24/flock-license-plate-reading-cameras-have-led-to-more-than-30-arrests-says-palm-springs-police-department?utm_campaign=EmailSignature&utm_source=PMO&utm_medium=Wisestamp 

	
 

		 <https://tracy.srv.wisestamp.com/px/wsid/GG1LX1QJMN.png> 

		 

		 

		On Fri, May 23, 2025 at 8:14?AM DEWITT Derek A <DDeWitt@eugene-or.gov DDeWitt@eugene-or.gov > wrote:

			Great placement, send it to the deployment tracker and I will approve it.

			
			Derek

			 

			Detective D. DeWitt

			Financial Crimes Unit

			Special Weapons and Tactics Team

			Background Investigations Team

			Eugene Police Department

			300 County Club Road

			Eugene, OR 97401

			Work hours: Tuesday - Friday 7:30 a.m. � 5:30 p.m.

			Desk Phone � 541-682-2682

			Work Cell � 541-743-6192

			 

			

			 

			From: Matt Triana <matt.triana@flocksafety.com matt.triana@flocksafety.com > 
			Sent: Friday, May 23, 2025 6:56 AM
			To: DEWITT Derek A <DDeWitt@eugene-or.gov DDeWitt@eugene-or.gov >
			Subject: Re: FW: City of Eugene Requested: ALPR mapping project

			 

			[EXTERNAL ?]

			Hi Detective,

			 

			We worked with Bret and revised the placement of camera F042 on your Deployment Plan https://planner.flocksafety.com/planning-portal/deployment-tracker/public/0f92e14e805f30bf6acf29115ee1c5822b6098ae5c2df90d1c711d20287fcfc85c97710dd98fe864a5dac6f9814a58b68c5803a8fb3289594d80da7ee50a5761  so that it is out of ODOT ROW. Please take a look and let me know if you are ok with this location. It should get the same capture as it did before, we're just a little further north now.

			 

			At this moment the location name still reflects the old cross streets. I have asked for this to be updated to reflect the current location. Just an FYI if you notice this when you look.

			 

			Please let me know if you have any questions.

			 

			Regards

	
 

Matt Triana
Project Manager



	
 https://kesq.com/news/2024/06/24/flock-license-plate-reading-cameras-have-led-to-more-than-30-arrests-says-palm-springs-police-department?utm_campaign=EmailSignature&utm_source=PMO&utm_medium=Wisestamp 

	
 

			 <https://tracy.srv.wisestamp.com/px/wsid/GG1LX1QJMN.png> 

			 

			 

			On Thu, May 22, 2025 at 7:53?AM DEWITT Derek A <DDeWitt@eugene-or.gov DDeWitt@eugene-or.gov > wrote:

				Can you give me a call this morning.  541-682-2682

				
				Derek

				 

				Detective D. DeWitt

				Financial Crimes Unit

				Special Weapons and Tactics Team

				Background Investigations Team

				Eugene Police Department

				300 County Club Road

				Eugene, OR 97401

				Work hours: Tuesday - Friday 7:30 a.m. � 5:30 p.m.

				Desk Phone � 541-682-2682

				Work Cell � 541-743-6192

				 

				

				 

				From: Matt Triana <matt.triana@flocksafety.com matt.triana@flocksafety.com > 
				Sent: Wednesday, May 21, 2025 2:34 PM
				To: BURKE Jacob T <JBurke@eugene-or.gov JBurke@eugene-or.gov >
				Cc: DEWITT Derek A <DDeWitt@eugene-or.gov DDeWitt@eugene-or.gov >
				Subject: Re: FW: City of Eugene Requested: ALPR mapping project

				 

				[EXTERNAL ?]

				Thank you! Looks like the one he is referring to is F042 which we are not moving to install at this time due to it being in ODOT ROW.

				 

				Based on the below email, locations F024 and F025 are actually not in ODOT ROW. Here are the location coordinates for easy reviewing of these locations:

				 

				F024: 44.065012, -123.137917

				F025: 44.084968, -123.154894

				 

				Are these actually COE?

	
 

Matt Triana
Project Manager



	
 https://kesq.com/news/2024/06/24/flock-license-plate-reading-cameras-have-led-to-more-than-30-arrests-says-palm-springs-police-department?utm_campaign=EmailSignature&utm_source=PMO&utm_medium=Wisestamp 

	
 

				 <https://tracy.srv.wisestamp.com/px/wsid/GG1LX1QJMN.png> 

				 

				 

				On Wed, May 21, 2025 at 2:26?PM BURKE Jacob T <JBurke@eugene-or.gov JBurke@eugene-or.gov > wrote:

					This was a message from ODOT regarding the locations.  

					 

					 

					Jake Burke

					Captain � Investigations Division

					Eugene Police Department

					300 Country Club Road

					Eugene, Oregon 97401

					(541) 682-5895 work

					 

					 

					

					 

					From: GAMBLE James M <James.GAMBLE@odot.oregon.gov James.GAMBLE@odot.oregon.gov > 
					Sent: Wednesday, May 21, 2025 2:23 PM
					To: BURKE Jacob T <JBurke@eugene-or.gov JBurke@eugene-or.gov >
					Cc: ALEXANDER Eric A <Eric.A.ALEXANDER@odot.oregon.gov Eric.A.ALEXANDER@odot.oregon.gov >
					Subject: RE: City of Eugene Requested: ALPR mapping project 

					 

					[EXTERNAL ?]

					Good afternoon Jake,

					 

					I have not heard from upline management yet. What I did notice after reviewing the 5-license plate reader location plan (attached) the only location on ODOT R/W is Beltline @ W 11th.  

					 

					The other 4 locations on OR99E were jurisdictionally transferred to the City of Eugene in July of 2018 (JT830), meaning no IGA / Permit needed.  

					 

					Any questions let us know thanks -Jim

					 

					Jim Gamble

					District 5 Manager 

					ODOT, Region 2

					2080 Laura Street Springfield OR 97477

					Office: 541-726-2541

					Cell: 541-521-1804

					 

					From: BURKE Jacob T <JBurke@eugene-or.gov JBurke@eugene-or.gov > 
					Sent: Monday, May 12, 2025 7:41 AM
					To: GAMBLE James M <James.GAMBLE@odot.oregon.gov James.GAMBLE@odot.oregon.gov >
					Subject: RE: City of Eugene Requested: ALPR mapping project 

					 

	This message was sent from outside the organization. Treat attachments, links and requests with caution. Be conscious of the information you share if you respond. 

					Good morning, James, 

					 

					Checking in to see if Flock reached out to you about install of cameras at any ODOT related intersections in or near the city.  Their install groups are starting to do site surveys in the city and moving quickly.  

					 

					Thanks

					 

					 

					Jake Burke

					Captain � Investigations Division

					Eugene Police Department

					300 Country Club Road

					Eugene, Oregon 97401

					(541) 682-5895 work

					 

					 

					

					 

					From: GAMBLE James M <James.GAMBLE@odot.oregon.gov James.GAMBLE@odot.oregon.gov > 
					Sent: Friday, April 18, 2025 11:54 AM
					To: BURKE Jacob T <JBurke@eugene-or.gov JBurke@eugene-or.gov >
					Cc: ALEXANDER Eric A <Eric.A.ALEXANDER@odot.oregon.gov Eric.A.ALEXANDER@odot.oregon.gov >
					Subject: RE: City of Eugene Requested: ALPR mapping project 

					 

					[EXTERNAL ?]

					Just send it to me for now and we can route it from there, my contact info is listed below. Thanks -Jim

					 

					Jim Gamble

					District 5 Manager 

					ODOT, Region 2

					2080 Laura Street Springfield OR 97477

					Office: 541-726-2541

					 

					From: BURKE Jacob T <JBurke@eugene-or.gov JBurke@eugene-or.gov > 
					Sent: Friday, April 18, 2025 8:15 AM
					To: GAMBLE James M <James.GAMBLE@odot.oregon.gov James.GAMBLE@odot.oregon.gov >
					Subject: RE: City of Eugene Requested: ALPR mapping project 

					 

	This message was sent from outside the organization. Treat attachments, links and requests with caution. Be conscious of the information you share if you respond. 

					Good morning, James, 

					 

					We have signed our contract with Flock.  They are requesting a contact with ODOT for locations that may involve ODOT permissions.  Would you be the appropriate contact or can you suggest someone else with your agency?

					 

					Thank you 

					 

					 

					Jake Burke

					Captain � Investigations Division

					Eugene Police Department

					300 Country Club Road

					Eugene, Oregon 97401

					(541) 682-5895 work

					 

					 

					

					 

					From: GAMBLE James M <James.GAMBLE@odot.oregon.gov James.GAMBLE@odot.oregon.gov > 
					Sent: Friday, March 14, 2025 2:02 PM
					To: BURKE Jacob T <JBurke@eugene-or.gov JBurke@eugene-or.gov >
					Subject: FW: City of Eugene Requested: ALPR mapping project 

					 

					[EXTERNAL ?]

					Jake this is some good news written below, possibly in 2-4 months (ODOT Time) we will have a process to make this happen. Thanks -Jim

					 

					From: NEAVOLL Darrin L <Darrin.L.NEAVOLL@odot.oregon.gov Darrin.L.NEAVOLL@odot.oregon.gov > 
					Sent: Friday, March 14, 2025 10:31 AM
					To: GAMBLE James M <James.GAMBLE@odot.oregon.gov James.GAMBLE@odot.oregon.gov >
					Cc: MCGILL Galen E <Galen.E.MCGILL@odot.oregon.gov Galen.E.MCGILL@odot.oregon.gov >
					Subject: RE: City of Eugene Requested: ALPR mapping project 

					 

					Jim, thanks for reaching out. As Angela says, we are working on allowing them. We had 3 communities go out and put them on our R/W without permission and we had to have them removed. We are going to work with one of the communities to develop an IGA that would allow these on R/W. Within the IGA we will require anything that is installs a ground mount we will all do a Land Use Permit that will cost them $250 for the first year and $100 every year after. At this time we are saying nothing attached to our features or on interstate. 

					 

					We would like to get one through the process and then finalize our process and then open it up statewide. If you can hold the City of Eugene off a few months until we do that, we would appreciate that. Galen if I missed anything please let me know and Jim if you have follow up questions please let us know.

					 

					Thanks,

					 

					Darrin Neavoll 
					Region 3 Manager
					Office 541-957-3500
					Cell 541-580-7125 

					 

					From: GAMBLE James M <James.GAMBLE@odot.oregon.gov James.GAMBLE@odot.oregon.gov > 
					Sent: Friday, March 14, 2025 9:27 AM
					To: NEAVOLL Darrin L <Darrin.L.NEAVOLL@odot.oregon.gov Darrin.L.NEAVOLL@odot.oregon.gov >
					Subject: FW: City of Eugene Requested: ALPR mapping project 

					 

					Good morning Darrin,

					 

					We are working this request for the City of Eugene Police Department to install license plate readers (Automated License plate (ALPR) from Flock Safety) within ODOT R/W and was unsure if it is or has been possible to achieve a yes answer. EPD�s request is listed at the bottom of the thread and City of Eugene�s Traffic Manager is in the loop. 

					 

					The locations I believe are located where cameras/IT already exist, ITS has already stated this not allowed (shown below), and State Traffic suggested reaching out to you. 

					 

					If a TEAMS call easier that works also.  Thanks -Jim

					 

					Jim Gamble

					District 5 Manager 

					ODOT, Region 2

					2080 Laura Street Springfield OR 97477

					Office: 541-726-2541

					Cell: 541-521-1804

					 

					 

					From: KARGEL Angela J <Angela.J.KARGEL@odot.oregon.gov Angela.J.KARGEL@odot.oregon.gov > 
					Sent: Thursday, March 13, 2025 3:48 PM
					To: GAMBLE James M <James.GAMBLE@odot.oregon.gov James.GAMBLE@odot.oregon.gov >
					Cc: KIMLINGER Michael J <Michael.J.KIMLINGER@odot.oregon.gov Michael.J.KIMLINGER@odot.oregon.gov >
					Subject: RE: City of Eugene Requested: ALPR mapping project 

					 

					Hi Jim �Leadership is in the process of putting a new policy in place about license plate readers. (Our current  Passive Electronic Data Collection policy <https://ordot.sharepoint.com/sites/BusinessServices/Shared%20Documents/Forms/AllItems.aspx?id=%2fsites%2fBusinessServices%2fShared+Documents%2fADM+08+01.pdf&parent=%2fsites%2fBusinessServices%2fShared+Documents&%3d&sdata=VmhjVW9Lc2U5N0RrTjAyMjA5UUd3WHJZWEI4a1ByUmZtbS9URWVtZXRUWT0%3d>  does not allow for license plate readers on state highway right of way.)  I understand the recent effort involves the requesting law enforcement agency entering into an IGA with ODOT, and ODOT issuing a permit under the IGA criteria.  I haven�t been working on this personally so I don�t know more details.  Mike suggested you contact Galen McGill and R3 Manager Darrin Neavoll about the current work and how the City of Eugene�s request might fit in.  

					-Angela

					 

					 

					From: GAMBLE James M <James.GAMBLE@odot.oregon.gov James.GAMBLE@odot.oregon.gov > 
					Sent: Thursday,

thread_messages.body:
[EXTERNAL ?]

Detective,

Which location on Deployment Plan https://planner.flocksafety.com/planning-portal/deployment-tracker/public/0f92e14e805f30bf6acf29115ee1c5822b6098ae5c2df90d1c711d20287fcfc85c97710dd98fe864a5dac6f9814a58b68c5803a8fb3289594d80da7ee50a5761  is it? If you can confirm this and then share any photos that would be great. Send them to support@flocksafety.com support@flocksafety.com  with me cc'd on the email. They will be the ones to begin the steps to get this replaced. I would get this process started myself for you, but leadership on that team has said it is best when the customer reaches out to get the resolution process started.

Regards
	
 
Matt Triana
Project Manager

	Thank you for the update, hopefully lumen and the other entities can get this hashed out and we can install them all around the same time. We had a flock pole cut in half and damaged. So we will need to fix that one as well.  

	Detective D. DeWitt

thread_messages.subject: Re: FW: City of Eugene Requested: ALPR mapping project
thread_messages.body:
[EXTERNAL ?]

	Hi Detective,

	Happy Friday. Tobin looped in someone else from Lumen to assist with whatever joint use agreement they need. Hopefully she will get back to us with some info soon.

	By my count, we have a total of thirteen cameras left to install. Aside from the one Lumen pole location, some of these are city locations that we recently moved and are pending approval to move forward with from the city. Then there are the two county locations and the county told us recently that they were "sending these to permit processing." We will be following up with them next week. The leftovers are permitted and should be installed by the end of next week. Will get you another update next week.

	Please let me know if you have any questions.

	Regards
	
 
Matt Triana
Project Manager

[EXTERNAL ?]

				Thank you! Looks like the one he is referring to is F042 which we are not moving to install at this time due to it being in ODOT ROW.

				 

				Based on the below email, locations F024 and F025 are actually not in ODOT ROW. Here are the location coordinates for easy reviewing of these locations:

				 

				F024: 44.065012, -123.137917

				F025: 44.084968, -123.154894

				 

				Are these actually COE?

	
 

Matt Triana
Project Manager

				On Wed, May 21, 2025 at 2:26?PM BURKE Jacob T <JBurke@eugene-or.gov JBurke@eugene-or.gov > wrote:

					This was a message from ODOT regarding the locations.  

					 

					 

					Jake Burke

					Captain � Investigations Division

					Eugene Police Department

thread_messages.subject: RE: City of Eugene Requested: ALPR mapping project
thread_messages.body:
[EXTERNAL ?]

					Good afternoon Jake,

					 

					I have not heard from upline management yet. What I did notice after reviewing the 5-license plate reader location plan (attached) the only location on ODOT R/W is Beltline @ W 11th.  

					 

					The other 4 locations on OR99E were jurisdictionally transferred to the City of Eugene in July of 2018 (JT830), meaning no IGA / Permit needed.  

					 

					Any questions let us know thanks -Jim

					 

					Jim Gamble

					District 5 Manager 

					ODOT, Region 2

					2080 Laura Street Springfield OR 97477

					Office: 541-726-2541

					Cell: 541-521-1804

thread_messages.subject: FW: City of Eugene Requested: ALPR mapping project
thread_messages.body:
[EXTERNAL ?]

					Jake this is some good news written below, possibly in 2-4 months (ODOT Time) we will have a process to make this happen. Thanks -Jim

thread_messages.subject: RE: City of Eugene Requested: ALPR mapping project
thread_messages.body:
Jim, thanks for reaching out. As Angela says, we are working on allowing them. We had 3 communities go out and put them on our R/W without permission and we had to have them removed. We are going to work with one of the communities to develop an IGA that would allow these on R/W. Within the IGA we will require anything that is installs a ground mount we will all do a Land Use Permit that will cost them $250 for the first year and $100 every year after. At this time we are saying nothing attached to our features or on interstate. 

					 

					We would like to get one through the process and then finalize our process and then open it up statewide. If you can hold the City of Eugene off a few months until we do that, we would appreciate that. Galen if I missed anything please let me know and Jim if you have follow up questions please let us know.

					 

					Thanks,

					 

					Darrin Neavoll 
					Region 3 Manager
					Office 541-957-3500
					Cell 541-580-7125

thread_messages.subject: FW: City of Eugene Requested: ALPR mapping project
thread_messages.body:
Good morning Darrin,

					 

					We are working this request for the City of Eugene Police Department to install license plate readers (Automated License plate (ALPR) from Flock Safety) within ODOT R/W and was unsure if it is or has been possible to achieve a yes answer. EPD�s request is listed at the bottom of the thread and City of Eugene�s Traffic Manager is in the loop. 

					 

					The locations I believe are located where cameras/IT already exist, ITS has already stated this not allowed (shown below), and State Traffic suggested reaching out to you. 

					 

					If a TEAMS call easier that works also.  Thanks -Jim

					 

					Jim Gamble

					District 5 Manager 

					ODOT, Region 2

					2080 Laura Street Springfield OR 97477

					Office: 541-726-2541

					Cell: 541-521-1804

thread_messages.subject: RE: City of Eugene Requested: ALPR mapping project
thread_messages.body:
Hi Jim �Leadership is in the process of putting a new policy in place about license plate readers. (Our current  Passive Electronic Data Collection policy <https://ordot.sharepoint.com/sites/BusinessServices/Shared%20Documents/Forms/AllItems.aspx?id=%2fsites%2fBusinessServices%2fShared+Documents%2fADM+08+01.pdf&parent=%2fsites%2fBusinessServices%2fShared+Documents&%3d&sdata=VmhjVW9Lc2U5N0RrTjAyMjA5UUd3WHJZWEI4a1ByUmZtbS9URWVtZXRUWT0%3d>  does not allow for license plate readers on state highway right of way.)  I understand the recent effort involves the requesting law enforcement agency entering into an IGA with ODOT, and ODOT issuing a permit under the IGA criteria.  I haven�t been working on this personally so I don�t know more details.  Mike suggested you contact Galen McGill and R3 Manager Darrin Neavoll about the current work and how the City of Eugene�s request might fit in.  

					-Angela
